reviews.sentence: Amazing Stay Take advantage. This is the perfect hotel if you are traveling with family. The complimentary breakfast was amazing. Really enjoyed the gym and Jacuzi. Rooms were clean and relaxing. Hotel is located in the heart of all the stores you would love to shop at. My children loved it.

Would love to stay again. We were really pleased with the accommodations and service. The room was clean and we had access to washer and dryers that were of no additional cost. My family really enjoyed the breakfast with omletes made to order.

Great hotel great price. I always enjoyed staying at Embassy Suites and this time did not disappoint. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The 5 mi radius shuttle is great. Jekyl Brewery is a must visit. take the shuttle do nt drive and drive. The managers reception is great and the breakfast was delicious. Price is very reasonable as well. Free drinks shuttle Jekyl Brewery good sushi across the street Avalon has shopping and food as well. happy hour that started and ended about 1 hr later.

pretty good for the value. Staff was friendly and helpful when called upon. There were little extras in our room like candy bars and snacks. Breakfast had large variety to choose from and was freshly prepared. We wanted to go swimming and they were painting the side of the pool during the day. We felt like they could have done this when the pool was supposed to be closed. The water in the bathroom toilet ran all night. We finally turned it off and turned it back on bc we could not sleep.

I would definitely stay again. good experience. Breakfast was excellent. Our room was comfortable and the staff was super nice. Only one of the two elevators was working on the day we were leaving. this made it a little crowded and a longer wait time.
Convenient Alphareta Location. The room was nice and comfortable the complimentary breakfast was ok. the potatoes were overcooked but overall I had say for the price it was a good deal.

Nice affordable. Gray experience. Our stay was very pleasant. Staff was very nice and helpful. The room was large and clean. Breakfast was the best I have had at a hotel. Kids and wife loved it. While the hotel is a bit dated I believe they have kept it up well considering the age. Will stay again.

This hotel is conveniently located close to several shopping areas. we thought the hotel was nice but somewhat outdated. the room was spacious and kept clean. the complimentary reception in the afternoon was good. breakfast was a highlight. the omlets were great. all the staff seemed courteous and helpful. I would be willing to stay here again if we are ever in the area.

The hotel needs some upgrading but was nice and clean. The breakfast was awesome and Ms Lenora needs a RAISE. The staff provided great customer service and made me feel at home. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. The waterfall in the lobby and the Jacuzi in the poolroom is the icing on the cake. The staff being friendly efficient and yet professional I am willing to pay more for these traits but luckily did not have to. The location was not ideal for me but I came on the recommendation of someone else and have no regrets. I would stay again. The upgrades to the building. Like painting and carpet things were clean but worn.

Nice hotel. Our hotel was in a perfect area for our concert. It ’s currently under construction but I ’m sure it will be even better once finished. The only complaint was the pillows were awful but I should have known better to bring my own. Other than that it was wonderful.

Under Total Reno. It was obvious when we pulled up there were renovations going on outside but when we walked into the hotel the noise and temporary walls were a surprise. I understand having to do renovations just wish I would have known. Another surprise was when we walked in the bathroom and the top of the mirror was just about 5 and a half feet. Great for me because I am 5 foot 2 but my husband is 6 foot 4. Then I noticed from grabars in shower we were in an accessible room. We were told that is what Expedia assigned to us. Not sure why. Later in the night my husband went into bedroom to watch TV and to his surprise no remote AND no cables or power cord on TV. Called front desk and they immediately sent a maintenance man to fix the issue. Next morning we had a fabulous breakfast with so many selections even a omlet bar. Staff was great throughout the stay just wish I was aware of renos.
Good but noisy and construction. Under construction good.

BCuz of location and experiences with other Embassy Suites I would try it again AFTER construction. was nice. was great and the The There was no advance notice that the whole ground floor was undergoing a complete renovation and under a construction mess that was dirty noisy and crowded.

Room was clean and spacious. Breakfast was good. They offered free drinks and snacks from 530 730pm. They should have closed this hotel during the renovation. We had an air compressor cutting on and off all night near our room. Do not stay here until the renovation is complete. This hotel is going through a total renovation. The pool is closed everything is wrapped in plastic. The elevators in the lobby looked like they did not work. Safety is a big concern.

Nice location but hotel renovation put a damper on our stay outside of Atlanta. were great. Managers reception was a nice benefit as well but limited drink choices. Nice safe. was decent and. and TV programming was nice. Fridge and microwave were nice too. had comfortable The. cool at all. The bathroom door opened out and stuck so when you went to push it open you did so hard and you could have hit someone walking by. The hotel was completely under renovation and did not allow us to do anything. This information was not provided to us before booking so when we arrived we were very upset. Limited drink choices during the managers reception. No soda available during The thermostat did not make the.

Decpetive Advertising and No Notice. This was completely deceptive. The hotel was under major construction including the eating area lounge area and pool but there was no mention of that during my booking. I had specifically booked this hotel because of the indoor pool which was prominently displayed on the website. Also there was little to no discount for this condition. I would like a full refund beyond the first night so that we can book another hotel for our family Christmas.

Excellent. There were mass renovations which we were told about before reserving. The amount was shocking when you first walked in however the front desk staff was excellent in answering questions and assisting our family. For all the renos the floors and surrounding areas were kept very clean and the material was contained within the working areas. You can tell the renovations are going to look very nice from the sections that are already completed. During the Sunday breakfast the staff provided excellent service. My sister loved her omelet which was prepared for her. This was a good experience. Thank you for the great service and communication.

Excellent. There were mass renovations which we were told about before reserving. The amount was shocking when you first walked in however the front desk staff was excellent in answering questions and assisting our family. For all the renos the floors and surrounding areas were kept very clean and the material was contained within the working areas. You can tell the renovations are going to look very nice from the sections that are already completed. During the Sunday breakfast the staff provided excellent service. My sister loved her omelet which was prepared for her. This was a good experience. Thank you for the great service and communication.
Very pleasant. We were there for 1 night relocation to ATL. it was awesome place to spend it after 13 hr drive. Comfy beds good breakfast setup friendly stuff excellent customer service.

Um not Hilton ’s best. It was the most unprofessional Hilton hotel I have ever visited. The evening staff was disinterested in working or doing anything resembling Hilton ’s standard of customer service and professionalism. After driving 10 hours that day we finally arrived at the hotel and were shocked to see that the hotel was under renovations and the front desk clerk greeted me with a mouthful of food and simply said “ Hey ”. Then proceeded with check in informing me that because I did not book with Hilton directly but through a third party that I was not able to have the expected amenities that we received from the other far superior Hilton resorts that we stayed at which we were provided with despite being booked through the same third party as that reservation such as wifi and TWO bottles of water. Eager to take a shower and go to sleep after the exhausting trip take the soaking wet elevator no towels in pool area so families dripped dried throughout the hotel to our room to find no soap in the room as well as the shower curtain was just tossed on the suite ’s sofa. Immediately called the front desk from the room ’s phone no answer. After repeatedly calling for what seemed like 10 minutes same clerk from earlier answered she must ’ve finished eating and I notified her of the problem. She later contacted housekeeping and someone then hung the curtain with subsequent phone calls being made in order to get the other missing items. Vending was also disabled for our floor due to remodeli.

Great hotel at a great price. Better breakfast buffet than many other hotels. They even offer free cocktails and snacks for 2 hrs. Indoor pool was a plus and decent fitness center. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean. I will definitely visit this hotel again.

Everything was nice. The room was clean. The service was great. The breakfast was a real one and tasted wonderful. The reason why I give it a 4 is Because the indoor pool was so COLD. It should have had some warmth to it. My girls lips were blue and their skin ice cold after playing for 2 hours. Also they do not have a hot tub for you to at least balance the temperature out. Nevertheless we would stay here again. It was nice and close to shops and restaurants.

Very Good. Friendly staff. Text inquiry on how I was doing was helpful b c there was a lamp missing in my room. It was remedied very promptly. but I was n’t able to reach someone when I tried to call the front desk shortly after I arrived in my romGym smells horribly. Yuck. Exercising is important to me and i ’m Considering booking somewhere else for my next trip because I ca n’t exercise in that room. Bathroom seemed a little tired shower chips etc.

Everything was great expect the environment did n’t allow for much sleep. The property was beautiful and we loved happy hour and breakfast and snacks. The room eas very nice as well. It was very hard to sleep bc the air conditioning made a loud banging noise. Also an alarm that we did n’t set went off at 6 am. I could here loud neighbors on either side of our room also. Honestly there was little sleep bc of all the interruptions which was disappointing.

Good. Staff was uninformed. We requested a bathtub but were told by staff at check in that there were no bathtubs in the entire hotel. When we reached our room there was indeed a bathtub. At one point our key and our friends key would not work. We were treated rudely by staff when we went to front desk to get new keys. We were interrupted and made to feel shame.
Birthday getaway. Took awhile for a room I cam a bit early though but it seem that every other room was ready Except the king that I reserved.
I would definitely plan another stay at this property. The hotel was very pleasant relaxing atmosphere and comfortable beds. The breakfast was outstanding especially the omelet station.

The laundry facilities consisted of two combination washer dryer machines. They did not adequately dry our clothing even after several hours. When we showed our wet clothes to the front desk the employee said that is a common conplaint from guests and offered no apology. I suggested they put a sign up to warn guests. Our plans for that evening and the following morning were thwarted as we continued trying to dry our clothes. They should have more than two elevators.

Good. Friendly staff at front desk Dinning room and lounge. Keny is a excellent bar tender with a great personality. All staff members seem genuinely interested and eager to help or answer any questions. Beds were nice and comfortable. I thought the price I was charged for the weekdays was excessive. I believe my rate for Sunday was 1390 and the week days 2160. My room 510 had food crumbs left on the counter top behind the container holding the coffee packages. The bathroom floor looked dirty around the edges close to the walls. Parking area needs to have better lighting.

I checked in and as others have stated staff not so friendly. The gentleman gave me my keys and number was on the envelope. When I arrived at the door of my room my key did not work. I pulled out the second key and checked the room number written on the card holder. The door still did not open. Since I was checking in at 11 pm after my daughters wedding I was exhausted. I called the front desk and explained my situation and was put on hold several times. I was told to come back to the desk to resolve the issue. At this point I was not happy to say the least. I politely asked them to please send someone up to help me. As I ’m waiting a security guard comes by and asked if I needed help. Of course I did. I thought that was the person the front desk had sent to help me. He tried both keys and checked for the correct room number. After doing so he opened the door with his key. To my SURPRISE someone was sleeping on the pull out sofa. I was speechless. And the security guard was as surprised as I was. By this time the gentleman that checked me in had arrived. We explained what had happened to him and I asked if it might be the room on the 5th floor instead of the 6th. Because that ’s the floor he told me originally. He said NO. By this time I ’ve had enough. It ’s 130 pm and I ’m exhausted. He and the security guard left to go see what the problem was. The security guard came back and was very nice. Took my luggage for me and off to the 5th floor we went. I asked if I was right and he said yes you were. The room was nice and clean. But if someone had opened the door on me like we did on the other person I would have had a heart attack. Especially being alone. The next morning at checkout the lady was not nice. I asked to speak with the manager and he came. But sad to say he was n’t any help at all. Would I stay there again. Absolutely not. Would I recommend this hotel to someone else. Absolutely not. Staff could have been nicer. The gentleman that checked me in would not believe that he made a mistake and put me on the wrong floor after telling me 5th floor. Very rude. My nephew and his wife was staying there as well. No issues with there stay. My daughter had set aside rooms for the wedding guest. I was contacted via text to ask about my stay. I explained the situation and was assured someone would call within a couple of days. Still no phone call. That was April 20th.
